1.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jirmejah, the name of eight or nine Israelites
properly, double, i.e. second; also adverbially, again

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
to inclose; by analogy, to hold back; also to maintain, rule, assemble
a yard (as inclosed by a fence); also a hamlet (as similarly surrounded with walls)
a jail (as a guard-house); also an aim (as being closely watched)

2.brief: properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to mould into a form; especially as apotter; figuratively, to determine (i.e. form a resolution)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

3.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
to gather grapes; also to be isolated (i.e. inaccessible by height or fortification)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement

to feed on; figuratively, to consume; by implication, to battle (as destruction)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
a Kasdite, or descendant of Kesed; by implication, a Chaldaean (as if so descended); also an astrologer (as if proverbial of that people

properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.

to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)

to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively

properly, curative, i.e. literally (concretely) a medicine, or (abstractly) a cure; figuratively (concretely) deliverance, or (abstractly) placidity
properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace

exile, concretely, prisoners; figuratively, a former state of prosperity
